Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2011 09:58PM ILoveDisneyland wrote: I just had an excisional biopsy on Friday.  The doctor thought the results would be in around Wednesday and he said he would call me.  I also have heard of doctors only giving out results at the post-op visit.  Sometimes, it's hard to know what to expect.
Posts.Title: Still Waiting AMP614 BeingHopeful1

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2011 08:34PM ILoveDisneyland wrote: I have a similar situation.  I had a core needle biopsy on a "probable benign fibroadenoma" BIRAD 3.  The original recommendation after my ultrasound was f/u in 6 months, but my doc didn't like that.  The radiologist that did the biopsy called my lesion "low suspicion."  When the pathology report came back, my GYN's nurse called and said it was benign, BUT she didn't read the part that said consistent with benign fibroadenoma BUT it also said recommend excision due to increased cellularity in the stroma.  This appears that they are wanting to rule out a phyllodes tumor.  I am now a birads 4.  I consulted a breast surgeon who looked at all the reports and films and agreed excisional biopsy is the way to go.  I had general anesthesia and beforehand needed a wire localization.  I think the excisional biopsy is easier than the core needle biopsy physically.  My procedure was Friday and I doing the dreaded wait for results.  My surgeon said the results should be in tomorrow.  He had told me at consult he felt my chances of b9 are good, but we all know that nothing is for sure, so I am very afraid. I think it's best to just have the thing out and try to remain hopeful.  My GYN told me he wasn't super worried due to no cancer or pre-cancer found during the core needle and also the appearance of the lesion.  My lesion is non-palpable and was found as an incidental finding while looking at another area that ended up being negative.
Posts.Title: Birads 5 Wabi-sabi leaf

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2011 12:33AM ILoveDisneyland wrote: PS.  The lump is small and non-palpable and not visible on a mammogram.
